snippet: A Postal Service program created after anthrax attacks gathers photos of the exterior of every piece of paper mail processed in the nation — about 160 billion pieces last year.
abstract: Postal Service confirms program created after 2001 anthrax attacks that gathers photos of exterior of every piece of paper mail processed in the nation, about 160 billion pieces in 2012; revelation about seemingly low-tech but prevalent Postal Service snooping comes as world focuses on surveillance programs of National Security Agency.
lead_paragraph: A Postal Service program created after anthrax attacks gathers photos of the exterior of every piece of paper mail processed in the nation — about 160 billion pieces last year.

headline.main: U.S. Postal Service Logging All Mail for Law Enforcement
headline.print_headline: Postal Service Is Watching, Too: Outside of All Mail Is Recorded
